author: plcarmona
title: Music Database MIDI blockchain
description: The way in wich we can relation with music actually is very limited.

assessments.note:
The proposal describes a very generic problem without specifying which aspects of the problem could be solved with the use of the Cardano Blockchain and consequently drive user adoption or increase the utility of Cardano.
The general idea (of being able to share and search for music) is cool, but it would be useful to deepen the aspects of this process related to decentralization and the use of the blockchain.
does not address. has nothing to do with blockchain

The proposal suggests the creation of a dapp, but there is no clarity on the importance of using the blockchain, what kind of information would be stored on the blockchain? How important would be a dapp? From what has been described a conventional app could solve the problem. In order for us to understand what the impact of dapp on the blockchain is, we need to know what type of transactions can be carried out on the blockchain and what type of data would be stored on the blockchain, so that we can have some sense of how the proposal will address the challenge

The idea can be cool, but it lacks an incentive.
There is no mention of a ROI anywhere, so it would basically be money down the drain unless there is a way to make this profitable added in the proposal.

Unfortunately, this proposal does not provide necessary detail on how it aligns with the goals of the community nor where exactly the utility will come from. Thinking about proposal in these terms will help it nail down the scope better. It is really just an idea at the moment.

It is not indicated what is the final product that will be developed for this proposal (A website? A mobile app?).
The part relating to the design of a system to boost the music development as well as the one that talks about the development of an AI, seem to me very marginal and not adhering to the main topic (the development of a dapp).
It is not clear what the place of the "smart contract" is in the general picture and how its features will interact with the app in general and with users.
In general for a proposal in the Dapps Challenge it would be useful to specify the development architecture and the languages/technologies that will be used, a development roadmap, costs breakdown and the composition of the team that will work on the project.
and quote "I start play piano like 4 years ago totally by selflearning, and i allways search for a simple way to search and make music"

There is not enough information about the plan to understand where the blockchain fits into the project and without it there is no indication of success in the implementation. The proposer did not report any experience as a developer or mentioned the need to hire someone to develop dapp.
The experience provided is not relevant to create a database of this kind. Who would build it?

There is no information that would help us consider this proposal to be investable. There are no established experiences with validity in the sector - external links to previous work or professional page, nor any sensible understanding of why this budget and what it will accomplish exactly. Adding these crucial elements could help bring forward this proposal better. It really needs a plan which isn't here just yet.

It is not defined what the success will be for the project and no goal or metrics that will help the community to understand it.
For a proposal in the "Dapps Challenge", for example, could be really useful to specify how many users are expected in a defined period of time, how many transaction could generate each user with an average engagement and other KPIs like these one.

There is not enough information to check the feasibility and how the proposal addresses the challenge. I recommend that the proposer clarifies the need to use blockchain in this project and follow the Catalyst guidelines to elaborate the proposal.

No roadmap or funding breakdown is provided.
Information on how this project would be marketed or implemented is present in the proposal.
There is no risk assessment. What if the user base would be too small to profitably monetise?

Absent of roadmap and milestones - it is not possible to evaluate intentions here. Proposal is just an idea - not an executable format yet. Adding also definition of success metrics, KPIs, challenges, risks - all these basic elements will help it get better in the future. But not at the moment in case it doesn't get funded.
